trans-unit.source: Provides several different visual representations for a list of selectable items.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> class maintains the selection of single or multiple selected items.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> is derived directly from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl> class and does not have any of the pagination handling properties, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter.ItemWeight%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Notifies the server control that an element, either XML or HTML, was parsed, and adds the element to the server control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Controls"></xref> collection object.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The object reference to add to the server control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Controls"></xref> collection object.
Creates items in an items collection from the specified dataSource parameter.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Inheriting classes can override this method for custom data-binding behavior.
The source from which items in the collection are created.
Gets or sets the data member to extract when data binding to a list data source.
The default value is an empty string ("").
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

This property is only used if the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.DataSource%2A> property is of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IListSource>, rather than of type <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable>.
The data member to extract when data binding to a list data source.
Gets or sets the data source of the list that is being bound.
The default value is `null`.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
To bind a data source to a list, you must first use the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.DataBind%2A> method to ensure data binding.
The data source can either be of type <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable>, or it can be of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IListSource>.
If the data source is of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IListSource>, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.DataMember%2A> field to specify which member to extract.
The data source of the list that is being bound.
Specifies which property of a data-bound item to use when binding an item's <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text"></xref> property.
The default is `null`.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The property of a data-bound item to use when binding an item's <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text"></xref> property.
Specifies which property of a data-bound item to use when binding an item's <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value"></xref> property.
The default is `null`.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The property of a data-bound item to use when binding an item's <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value"></xref> property.
Returns `true` if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList"></xref> allows multiple selections.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

To create a multiple-selection <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList>, set its <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.SelectType%2A> property to <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListSelectType?displayProperty=fullName>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList"></xref> allows multiple selections; otherwise, `false`.
Occurs when an item in the list is bound to data.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
When an item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> control is created and data-bound, this event handler sets the properties of the list item from arbitrary expressions.
An item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> control is of type <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem>.
This event is raised as each data source item is bound.

This is the best time to filter or group items of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> collection, by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value%2A> property.
Returns the collection of items in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection"></xref> list.
The default value is an empty collection.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

You can add or remove items from a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection.Remove%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection.RemoveAt%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> class.
The collection of items in the selection list.
Processes the postback data for this control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.LoadPostData%2A> method uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter.LoadPostData%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter> object referenced by the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.Adapter%2A> property to load data into the control from the post data sent by the client browser.

If there is no device-specific handling for loading the postback data on this control, then the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter.LoadPostData%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method returns `true`.
The key identifier for the control.
The collection of all incoming named values.
`true` if the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList"></xref> changes as a result of the postback; otherwise, `false`.

the call to <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter.LoadPostData(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.Object,System.Boolean@)"></xref> on the object referenced by <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.Adapter"></xref> returns `false`.
Restores view-state information from a previous page request that was saved by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.SaveViewState"></xref> method.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An object that contains the previous view-state information.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.ItemDataBind"></xref> event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
None.
Called when a list item is data bound.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The default implementation raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.ItemDataBind> event.
Inheriting classes can override this method to perform other tasks.
An object (defined by <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListDataBindEventArgs"></xref>) that contains event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.PreRender"></xref> event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
None.
Called when the selected index changes.
The list must be in selection mode for this method to be called.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The default implementation raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.SelectedIndexChanged> event.
Inheriting classes can override this method to perform other tasks.
An object defined by an <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> object that contains event data.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList"></xref> that the post data has changed.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.OnSelectedIndexChanged%2A> method with <xref:System.EventArgs.Empty> as the event argument.
Gets or sets the number of rows in the selection list.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The default value is 4; the minimum is 1, with no maximum.
The number of rows in the selection list.
an attempt was made to set the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList"></xref> value to less than zero.
Saves any server control view-state changes that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
None.
Returns the index of the selected item.
The default value is -1.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
If the control is in multiple selection mode, this property returns the index of the first selected item.
The selected index cannot be set declaratively; use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Selected%2A> property of a list item instead.
Set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.SelectedIndex%2A> to -1 to clear the selection.
This is useful when you want to dynamically remove items from the list.
The index of the selected item.
an attempt was made to set the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.SelectedIndex"></xref> property to less than `-1` or greater than or equal to the number of items.
Occurs whenever a user changes the selection of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList"></xref> object.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Changing the selection on the client does not generate a postback event.
This event is called on the server if a postback event is generated by some other control and the selection has changed.
Returns the selected item, or `null` if there is no selection.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
If the control is in multiple selection mode, this property returns the first selected item.
The currently selected item in the selection list.
Gets or sets the type of UI used to provide a selection UI.
Must be of type <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListSelectType"></xref>.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListSelectType.DropDown"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> object can be rendered as a `CheckBox`, `DropDown`, `ListBox`, `MultiSelectListBox`, or `Radio` list, depending on the target device.
The selection type also affects whether the control allows the user to select multiple items.
The `MultiSelectListBox` and `CheckBox` settings allow multiple selections; other settings allow only a single selection.
The selection types are shown in the following table.
`ListSelectType` value
Description
Multiselect
Renders list items with check boxes and multiple selection capability.
Yes
Renders list items in a drop-down list box.
No
Renders list items in a list box.
No
Renders list items in a list box with multiple selection capability.
Yes
Renders list items as options.
No
Type of UI used to provide a selection UI.
Gets or sets the `Title` attribute on WML devices.
The default value is an empty `string`.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The `Title` attribute on WML devices.
Causes tracking of view-state changes to the server control so they can be stored in the server control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
This object is accessible through the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState"></xref> property.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.LoadPostData(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface.
The key identifying the relevant value in the data.
The collection containing the post data.
`true` if the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList"></xref> changes as a result of the postback; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.RaisePostDataChangedEvent"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface.
